Downgrade Rights are where end users who have acquired the Latest Version of some kind of software can use an earlier version of that same software, until they are ready to migrate to the later version of the Software/Technology.

questions.question_text: Which of the following BEST describes the concept of right to downgrade?

choices.C: It allows for a previous version of an OS to be deployed in a test environment for each current license that is purchased
choices.D: It allows a previous version of an OS to be installed and covered by the same license as the newer version
choices.B: It allows a server to run on fewer resources than what is outlined in the minimum requirements document without purchasing a license
choices.A: It allows for the return of a new OS license if the newer OS is not compatible with the currently installed software and is returning to the previously used OS

questions.question_text: Which of the following licensing models was created by software companies in response to the increasing density of processors?

discussion.content:
With the release of Microsoft SQL Server 2012, Microsoft server licensing shifted the measure of computing power from physical 
processors to cores. Core-based licensing provides a more precise measure of computing power and a more consistent licensing metric, regardless of whether solutions are deployed on physical servers on-premises, or in virtual or cloud environments.

Selected Answer: B
Going with (B) Incremental. If it was Differential we should see the 102-104 .bak files compound in size.

* Differential backups slow as the week progresses, but have faster restoral times.
Incremental have quicker backup times, but slower restoral times.

Selected Answer: B
B. Incremental
Don't get distracted. The question is not just definitions, it's about your ability to reason.

1. Assume 01012020.bak (100MB) and 01052020.bak (120MB) are full backups due to their size in comparison to other .bak files.
2. 01022020.bak is 10MB followed by 01032020.bak is only 5MB, we can assume that these are incremental backups. If they were differential, 01032020.bak would be 15MB, inclusive of the 5MB from that day, and the 10MB from the day before.
3. file size of the last two .bak files are in ascending order, since Differential backups increase in size daily. This is a distraction. A well planned disaster recovery plan would not do Full/Incremental for one cycle, then follow the next cycle with Full/Differential. You can assume that the last .bak file in the list is simply coincidentally larger than the day prior.
4. Thus, the backup routine appears to be a full backup followed by incremental backups for the next three days.

Selected Answer: D
Incremental would require every incremental backup since a full backup on 0101 so would require 0101, 0102, 0103, 0104, 0105, 0106 assuming the last full backup was 0101. Differential would require only 0106 and 0101 so D is correct

comments.content:
So this is tricky assuming the backup on 1/5 is a full backup. That would give you two correct answers (Incremental and Differential). It could be incremental because you need all incremental backups after the last full backup, which was on 1/5. It could also be differential because you need the latest differential and the latest full backup to restore.
I think I may change my answer to incremental since the file size is not getting bigger with each incremental backup. This is probably an incremental backup.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Differential

 "differential backup" requires another file to restore data. In a differential backup, data that has changed since the last full backup is backed up. To restore the data, you need the last full backup and the most recent differential backup.

D. Differential

A "differential backup" requires another file to restore data. In a differential backup, data that has changed since the last full backup is backed up. To restore the data, you need the last full backup and the most recent differential backup. This is in contrast to an incremental backup, where you need the last full backup and all the incremental backups since that full backup to restore the data.

The differential backup is the backup type that requires another file to restore data. It requires a full backup and the latest differential backup (or the relevant differential backup for an older recovery point) to recover data

Selected Answer: B
Encryption will not prevent hacking but will protect files as B best portrays.

Selected Answer: D
D. databases in use are protected from remote hackers.

Selected Answer: B
B. files stored on the server are protected against physical theft.

Data at rest is one of the three states of digital data and it refers to any digital information that is stationary and contained within permanent storage devices, such as hard drives and tapes, or information reservoirs such as off-site backups, databases, archives, etc. The other states of digital data are data in motion, and data in use. Once data is transported and settles in its final destination, it is called data at rest during the entire period it remains inactive.

questions.question_text: The management team has mandated the use of data-at-rest encryption on all corporate servers. Using this encryption paradigm will ensure:

choices.C: attachments that are emailed from this server cannot be intercepted.
choices.B: files stored on the server are protected against physical theft.
choices.D: databases in use are protected from remote hackers.
choices.A: website traffic is protected while traversing the internet.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
sounds more like community cloud to me. here is why. A community cloud is a cloud infrastructure that is shared between different organizations or individuals from a specific community with common concerns or interest. The two developers form a small community working on a shared project. Community clouds lie somewhere between private and public clouds, offering a balance of shared resources and restricted access. It's important to note that this is not a public cloud, as access is restricted to the two developers rather than being open to the general public.

Selected Answer: B
If at any time the scenario mentioned "only" the developers/company had access to the cloud resources provided I would have selected Community. At face value, "B. Public" makes the most sense.

Selected Answer: B
B. Public

Selected Answer: B
B. Public. This is a type of cloud model that is an example of two developers working together on a project and building out a set of shared servers that both developers can access over the internet. A public cloud model means that the cloud services are provided by a third-party provider over the public internet and are available to anyone who wants to use or purchase them. A public cloud model offers the benefits of low cost, scalability, reliability, and flexibility, but may have less control, security, and customization than other cloud models.

comments.content:

Where resources are the Shared Servers and they're both developers. If you try and imagine the guy making this question up you can almost see what he's intending as the answer. I think the answer may indeed be community cloud.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The correct answer is B.

A public cloud is a cloud computing model in which a third-party provider makes computing resources, such as servers, storage, and applications, available to the general public over the internet. Public clouds are typically used by businesses and organizations that need to scale their IT resources quickly and easily.

In this case, the two developers are using a public cloud to share servers that they can both access over the internet. This is a common use case for public clouds, as it allows businesses and organizations to collaborate on projects without having to invest in their own IT infrastructure.

questions.question_text: Two developers are working together on a project, and they have built out a set of shared servers that both developers can access over the internet. Which of the following cloud models is this an example of?
